intro: Androsace chamaejasme var. triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered rock jasmine, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters of three, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
